intro: Linanthus harknessii, commonly known as Harkness's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. It has small, narrow leaves and produces white or pale blue blooms. Linanthus harknessii is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
